person.persName: Samuel S. Scott (Provisional government of Kentucky)

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky, physician, surgeon, and politician. Owen County, Kentucky, native. Son of Robert M. Scott. Married to Evelyn F. O’Hara Scott in Owen County on November 11, 1845. Father of Charles O’Hara Scott, Mary L. Scott, Robert A. Scott, and John Scott. Worked as a clerk in John C. Lindsay’s store in Ghent,Carroll County, Kentucky. Graduated from the medical department at Transylvania University in 1842. Practiced medicine in Ghent. Physician in Boone County in 1850. Further education at the Medical College of Ohio in 1853. Member of the Jeffersonian Democratic Party and Whig Party. Served under General Lopez as a senior surgeon and recruiter, enlisting 250 Carroll County men as the Kentucky Regiment in the failed excursion to Cardenas, Cuba, in 1850. Physician in Boone County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860. Served in the 2nd Infantry Confederate regiment as a private from August 1, 1861, to 1862. Served in a Bowling Green hospital under Dr. David Yandell and in Major Phifer’s Arkansas Cavalry as a surgeon in 1861. Member of the Council of Ten in the provisional government of Kentucky. Returned to the Confederate medical service in various capacities as a surgeon with the Fourth Kentucky Cavalry from November 26, 1862, to 1865. Served as medical director for the Department of Southwest Virginia and East Tennessee. Joined with General John C. Breckinridge in North Carolina until he surrendered in June 1865. Returned to Kentucky and recommenced his work as a physician and surgeon.
